name: Forensic Toxicology
description: Forensic toxicology is the application of the principles and methods used in toxicology to matters related to the law. The fundamental foundation of forensic toxicology is pharmacology and analytical chemistry, thus lectures will focus on the review of pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, analytical techniques and quality assurance measures used in forensic toxicology, the effects of drugs on human performance, and post-mortem toxicology of illicit drugs, pharmaceutical drugs, and other poisons. (Priority given first to Forensic Science Specialists and Majors; then Minors)
